messages.messageBody:
Melaleuca has a bunch of great cleaning products that I've used and been
happy with. I think their website is www.melaleuca.com, but I can't find my
catalog at the moment to know for sure :).

Amy
Mama to Accalia (6/14/99)
"The hardest to learn was the least complicated" -Indigo Girls

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Dishwasher detergent
messages.msgSnippet: I have tried the Seventh Generation dishwasher gel and a few others but found they left a film on the dishes. Perhaps it is our hard water or that I should try
messages.messageBody:
I have tried the Seventh Generation dishwasher gel and a few others but
found they left a film on the dishes. Perhaps it is our hard water or that
I should try the powder instead of the gel. I wonder if there is something
(like vinegar or baking soda) that would boost the cleaning power of their
soap for hard water? I read that a company called Bio-Kleen has a good
dishwasher soap. Otherwise we do use the Seventh Generation toilet paper
and unbleached paper towels. When we recently switched to the brown paper
towels, my son said that his grandmother (my mom) would think the paper
towels were dirty! LOL My mother is a white paper, Lysol and bleach
fanatic. I don't think she's going to change after 65 years. BTW, She
hasn't seen the brown paper towels yet! :-)

Healthy New Years,
Olivia



> Date: Fri, 29 Dec 2000 20:32:07 -0800
>We use "Seventh Generation" automatic Dishwashing detergent. It's phosphate
>free, has no chlorine bleach, no dyes or fragrances, is non-toxic,
>biodegradable, and not tested on animals, has no animal ingredients.
